intro: Lampranthus cedarbergensis, commonly known as the Cedarberg ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and showy flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range from white to pink, bloom in summer and are borne on short, hairy stems. Lampranthus cedarbergensis is popular as a ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and striking appearance.
